pattern.name: Slope
pattern.description:
Slope of an attribute in time as estimated with a linear regression.
NOTE: Could calculate slope of two numerical attributes (in another pattern). NOTE: Whenever correlation is calculated manually, arithmetic overflow can happen. NOTE: DateToNumber function is automatically replaced with the database aware function call.
NOTE: What is the difference between this and correlation?
pattern.example: Trend of customer's balance on his account.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT @base , (count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@timeColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@timeColumn))/(count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@numericalColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@numericalColumn)) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable WHERE dateDiff(@baseDate, @timeColumn) < @timeRange GROUP BY @base

SELECT @base , (count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@timeColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@timeColumn))/(count(@numericalColumn)*sum(@numericalColumn*@numericalColumn) - sum(@numericalColumn)* sum(@numericalColumn)) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @timeColumn > DATE_ADD(@baseDate, INTERVAL -@timeRange day) GROUP BY @base
SELECT @base , regr_slope(@numericalColumn, dateToNumber(@timeColumn)) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @timeColumn > (@baseDate -@timeRange) GROUP BY @base
